doc.title: List of awards and nominations received by David Bowie
doc.text:
(born David Robert Jones
) was a British musician and actor.

He began his singing career under the name David Bowie in 1966 and won his first award in 1969
, when he won an
in 1971 which reached number three in the

Despite his next eleven studio albums all making the UK Top 10—including four number one albums
—he did not receive any more music awards or nominations until the early 1980s. He has since won eleven awards for his music
, including
: four

British Male Solo Artist at the 1984 and 2014 BRIT Awards
, an Outstanding Contribution Award at the 1996 BRIT Awards and an Icon Award at the 2016 Brit Awards which was awarded to him posthumously
; two

MTV Video Music Award for Best Male Video
MTV Video Music Award for Best Overall Performance

doc.text: Bowie began his acting career in the 1967
His first leading role was in the 1976 science fiction film

pagelink.id: The Man Who Fell to Earth

text.E: The Man Who Fell to Earth

doc.text: , a role for which he won a
at the 1976 Saturn Awards. He has also had an innovative presence on the Internet which led to his being awarded a lifetime achievement

quot.text: pushing the boundaries of art and technology with his digital empire

doc.text: He has won 45 awards from 105 nominations.

, he received the Outstanding Contribution to Music in 1996 and he received the BRITs Icon Award posthumously in 2016.

are presented annually to Canadian musical artists and bands to acknowledge their artistic and technical achievements in all aspects of music. New members of the Canadian Music Hall of Fame are also inducted as part of the awards ceremonies.
is awarded by the British Phonographic Industry and the British Association of Record Dealers for the best album from the United Kingdom or Ireland. Bowie has received three nominations.

, Bowie was made a Commander of the

pagelink.text: Commander of the Order of the British Empire
Science Fiction and Fantasy Hall of Fame

doc.text:
In September 2011
, Bowie became one of several prominent local figures to feature on the
that is available as an alternative to the pound sterling in the Brixton area. Bowie's face appears on the B£10 note.

and
, following his death on 10 January
,
announced that the first animal born in 2016 - a

chick
- would be named Bowie after the late singer.

On 5 January 2015
, a few days before his 68th birthday
, a main-belt asteroid was named

in his honour. On 13 January 2016
, Belgian astronomers at MIRA Public Observatory in conjunction with radio station Studio Brussels registered a new asterism of seven stars in the vicinity of Mars at the date of Bowie's death that
, when connected
, form the lightning bolt seen on Bowie's face on the cover of his Aladdin Sane album.
